Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Hipposin (natural AMPs; fish, animals; histone-derived; XXE)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: derived from histone H2A.Activity:  Active against Gram+ B. subtilis (MIC 1.3-2.5 uM), B-thuringiensis (MIC>80 uM), E. faecalis (MIC 40-80 uM), E. avicum (MIC 40-80 uM), S. aureus (MIC 40-80 uM), L. corenyformis (MIC 0.6-1.2 uM), L. ivanovii (MIC 0.6-1.2 uM),  S. epidermidis (MIC 10 uM), Gram- A. salmonicida (MIC 20 uM), E. coli ATCC 14763 or pHK22 or DH5alpha (MIC 2.5-5 uM), P. flourescences (MIC 20-40 uM), Pseudomonas sp. (MIC 20-40 uM), S. soneii (MIC 10-20 uM), V. anguillarum (MIC 2.5-10 uM, HI-644 strain MIC>80 uM), and V. salmonicida (MIC 10-20 uM).Chemical modification:  The peptide is acetylated at the N-terminus but this modification didn't appear to influence peptide activity.SAR: A fragment corresponding to residues 1 to 19 did not exhibit marked antimicrobial activity, whereas the fragment consisting of 16â€“39 amino acid (similar to buforin II) was active. Updated 3/2017; 7/2021; 11/2023; 4/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Birkemo GA, Luders T, Andersen O, Nes IF, Nissen-Meyer J2003
Literature Information.Title: Hipposin, a histone-derived antimicrobial peptide in Atlantic halibut (Hippoglossus hippoglossus L.).
